summary: INSTRUMENT CLUSTER DON'T WORK
WHEN I WAS TRYING TO TURN THE WHEEL TO GET OUT OF THE DRIVEWAY, MY STEERING WHEEL CAME OFF. I WAS ABOUT TO BACK UP AND IF I DID I WOULD HAVE LOST CONTROL AND CRASHED.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBERS: 00V305000 (STEERING), 99V213000 (STRUCTURE), 99V113000 (AIR BAGS), AND 95I00100 (LATCHES/LOCKS/LINKAGES); HOWEVER, THE PARTS TO DO THE REPAIRS WERE UNAVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE SERPENTINE BELT WOULD DETACH FROM THE VEHICLE WHEN IT WOULD RAIN OR WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS DRIVEN THROUGH A PUDDLE OF WATER. THE FAILURE WOULD CAUSE THE VEHICLE TO LOOSE POWER AND OVERHEAT. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED SEVERAL TIMES AND THE PULLEYS WERE REPLACED, BUT THE FAILURE CONTINUED TO RECUR. THE DEALER AND SEVERAL MECHANICS WERE UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHAT CAUSED THE CONSISTENT FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 230,426 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 241,625.

AIR BAGS DEPLOYED ON 1994 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN WITH BRAUN HANDICAPPED MODIFICATIONS WHILE IDLING IN THE DRIVEWAY DURING LOADING OF HANDICAPPED WOMAN.  ATTENDANT WAS INJURED DUE TO PROXIMITY OF HEAD TO PASSENGER SIDE AIRBAG. *TR

TL* - THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 DODGE CHRYSLER GRAND CARAVAN.  WHILE DRIVING AROUND A MOUNTAIN THE STEERING LOCKED AND LOST POWER STEERING.  THE CONTACT LET THE VEHICLE SIT FOR APPROXIMATELY 1/2 HOUR AND THE VEHICLE WAS DRIVABLE.  THERE WERE NO WARNING INDICATORS.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 66,000. THE DEALER DIDN'T TRY TO DUPLICATE THE FAILURE.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 165,000.*AK  THE CONSUMER STATED THAT HE REPLACED THE BELT IN 1996, BUT THE MECHANIC STATED THE BELT LOOKED FINE. UPDATE 05/10/07*TR

TL* -THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE  1994 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN WITH 150000 FAILURE MILEAGE WAS LEAKING GAS ON THE MANIFOLD.  THE CONTACT A MECHANIC DISCOVERED THAT THERE WAS A FUEL LEAK.  THERE WAS A RECALL # 00268000 ON THE 1996-2000 DODGE GRAND CARAVANS.   THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DRIVABLE , AND THE VEHICLE HAD NOT BEEN REPAIRED.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 150,000. *AK  THE FUEL RAIL WAS LEAKING FUEL AT THE END OF THE RAIL WHERE A PIPE JOINED THE 2 RAILS TOGETHER, FUEL LEAKED ON THE MANIFOLD AND A SMALL FIRE WAS IGNITED. UPDATED 04/30/07. *JB

VEHICLE STALLS WHILE DRIVING, USUALLY WHEN WEATHER IS VERY WARM.  NO INDICATION OF OVERHEATING.  LET SET FOR 10-15 MINUTES AND VEHICLE STARTS AND RUNS FINE UNTIL NEXT TIME.  HAS HAPPENED 6 TIMES IN THE LAST 3 YEARS, USUALLY ON THE INTERSTATE CAUSING A POTENTIALLY VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.  HAVE NOT HAD TO A DEALER TO CHECK OUT BUT HAVE SEEN OTHER COMPLAINTS ON THIS SITE BY PEOPLE WHO HAVE THIS SAME PROBLEM WHO HAVE TAKEN TO DEALER AND DEALER WAS NOT ABLE TO LOCATE THE SOURCE OF THE STALLING.

1994 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN, DRIVERS SIDE SEAT BACK BROKEN AT THE FIRST WELD ON THE VERTICAL PORTION OF THE SEAT BACK. CAR WAS BEING DRIVEN NORMALLY, NO ACCIDENT OR INCIDENT OCCURRED. THERE WAS NO WARNING, THE SEAT JUST WENT TO A RECLINED POSITION WHILE DRIVING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT IN ADDITION TO THE VERTICAL FRAME WELD FAILURE, A CASTING FAILURE OCCURRED ON THE HORIZONTAL PORTION OF THE SEAT FRAME IN THE VICINITY OF RECLINE LEVER. THE FRAME CASTING WAS COMPLETING SEVERED AND WOULD NOT HAVE RETAINED THE SEAT IN THE EVENT OF A SUDDEN DECELERATION. THE SEAT WAS UNSAFE BUT DID NOT REVEAL ITSELF UNTIL THE BACK FRAME WELD FAILURE.    MY STATE OF RESIDENCE IS WISCONSIN, YOUR PROGRAM DID NOT ALLOW ME TO ENTER THIS STATE SO I CHOOSE ONE AT RANDOM.  *NM

CONSUMER STATED THE SLIDING DOOR FELL OFF TRACK . THE PART HAD BEEN REPAIRED THREE TIMES, HOWEVER THE PROBLEM RECURRED. *AK  THE CONSUMER STATED THAT THE PARTS SEEM TO WEAR TO EASY AND RUST WHEN THEY SHOULD NOT.  *TC

(1) NO WARNING OF FAILURE.(2)  SERPENTINE BELT TENSIONER BOLT FAILED CAUSING LOSS OF POWER STEERING DURING A TURN.  NO CONSEQUENCES RESULTED FROM THIS PARTICULAR FAILURE BECAUSE THE FAILURE OCCURRED IN A PARKING LOT AT 5MPH.  UNDER DIFFERENT CIRCUMSTANCES (DOWNHILL ON TIGHT CURVE) THE FAILURE WOULD HAVE BEEN EXTREMELY DANGEROUS AND PROBABLY RESULT IN TOTAL LOSS OF CONTROL.(3) ANTICIPATE REPLACING THE TENSIONER AND RETURNING VEHICLE TO SERVICE.*AK

AIR BAG.  I OWN A 1994 GRAND CARAVAN.  I HAVE NO OTHER COMPLAINTS ABOUT THIS VEHICLE.  HOWEVER, THE AIR BAG HAS HAD A PROBLEM SINCE ALMOST DAY ONE.  THE AIRBAG PANEL LIGHT IS ALWAYS ILLUMINATED.  I RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE SEVERAL YEARS AGO ABOUT THIS PROBLEM AND HAD THE VAN TO THE DEALERSHIP FOR RECALL SERVICE TO RECTIFY THE OBVIOUSLY WIDESPREAD PROBLEM.  I BELIEVE IT WAS TIED TO A PROBLEM W/ THE REAR WINDOW WIPER CIRCUIT.  THIS IS A PROBLEM THAT WAS FIXED FOR ALL BUT A COUPLE OF MONTHS AND TO THIS DAY I DON'T HAVE A WORKING AIR BAG OR REAR WINDOW WIPER.  I CAN LIVE W/O THE WIPER, I'D LIKE TO HAVE WORKING SAFETY EQUIPMENT.   *NM
TRANSMISSON FAILURE.  *LA

WHEN THE CONSUMER CLOSED THE REAR HATCH THE HINGE ON THE UPPER RIGHT CAME OFF.  UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE BOLT HAD BROKEN IN HALF AND ONE HALF OF THE BOLT WAS STILL ATTACHED TO THE DOOR WHILE OTHER HALF FELL TO THE GROUND. THE PRESSURIZED MECHANISM WAS LOCKED IN THE OPEN POSITION AND IN ORDER TO CLOSE THE DOOR THE CONSUMER HAD NO CHOICE BUT TO PUNCTURE THE ROOF.  *NLM    *CB   *NLM

ENGINE HESITATES AS IF STARVING FOR FUEL AND STALLS WHILE TRAVELING,CHECK ENGINE LIGHT STAYS ON UNTIL YOU TURN OFF ENGINE AND RETSTART.  TAKEN TO DEALER AND NO TROUBLE CODES FOUND. FUEL PUMP, FUEL FILTER, FUEL INJECTOR O-RINGS, REPLACED.  HAS HAPPENED OVER LAST SIX YEARS, SOME 20 TIMES AND DEALER HAS NO CLUE. 125,000 MILES ON ENGINE.*AK

PURCHASED ON 5/2001 A USED 1994 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN WITH 93,000 MILES FROM CARMICHAEL AUTO EXCHANGE "AS IS". AFTER 1,000 MILES, TRANSMISSION FAILED. REPLACED @ $1875.60 WITH NEW MOPAR REBUILT AT 94,282. TOOK VEHICLE IN FOR TRANS SERVICE ON 3/8/2002 AT 109,252 TO DEALER. INSTALLED TRANSMISSION COOLER ON 4/2002. NOW REBUILT TRANSMISSION FAILED ON 7/7/2003 AT 150,325. THIS ADDED EXPENSE WILL COST $2600.00 AT MY EXPENSE. *AK
CONSUMER STATED THAT WHEN TURNING THE VEHICLE ON THE PASSENGER SIDE AIR BAG DEPLOYED. DEALER NOTIFIED .  *AK
WHILE DRIVING 60 MPH THE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FAILED AND FORCED THE CONSUMER TO PULL OFF THE ROAD.  *NLM.  *AK
GAS GAUGE SHOWS ERRATIC FUEL LEVEL - CAN END UP EMPTY BECAUSE OF FALSE READING SIMILAR TO NHTSA RECALL NO. 97V194 CHRYSLER CAMPAIGN NO. 755.  *NLM

TRANSAXLE ON 1994 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN LE FAILED CAUSING DAMAGE TO AXLES.  THE AXLES HAD TO BE REPLACED, ONE AXLE HAD TO BE REPLACED TWICE.  THEY ARE NOW FAILING AGAIN.  THE FRONT END WOBBLES AND SHAKES, ESPECIALLY WHEN ACCELERATING AND THE TRANSMISSION SHIFTS VERY HARSHLY, WITH A SLAM.  THE TRANSMISSION HAS AN INTERNAL LEAK SO THAT WE HAVE TO CHECK THE FLUID CONSTANTLY, BUT NO FLUID IS DRAINING ONTO THE STREET.    IT WILL COST US $2,500 TO REPAIR.  WHEN WE BOUGHT THE CAR 2 YEARS AGO IT HAD JUST HAD THE TRANSAXLE REPLACED.

WHEN WE BOUGHT THE VAN IN APRIL OF 2001 THE TRANSAXLE WOULD NOT SHIFT INTO REVERSE WHEN COLD.  THE VEHICLE HAS APPARENTLY BEEN WARMED UP BEFORE WE TEST DROVE IT.  THE TRANSMISSION FILTER AND FLUID WERE REPLACED AND THE TRANSMISSION WAS FINE UNTIL THE NEXT COLD SEASON .  THE FLUID AND FILTER WERE REPLACED AND THE TRANSMISSION WAS FINE UNTIL THE NEXT COLD SEASON.  THE FLUID AND FILTER WERE REPLACED AGAIN BUT IT DID NOT HELP.  THE TRANSMISSION STARTED OUT AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS YEAR'S COLD SEASON JUST NOT GOING INTO REVERSE WHILE COLD, THEN IT QUICKLY PROGRESSED TO NO FIRST GEAR OR REVERSE WHILE COLD.  DURING THE TIME WHEN IT HAD NO FIRST OR REVERSE THE TRANSMISSION WOULD GO INTO LIMP MODE. (CHRYSLER A-604 ULTRADRIVE) DURING THIS TIME THE TRANSMISSION ONLY FUNCTIONS IN SECOND GEAR (WHILE THE GEAR SELECTOR IS IN OVERDRIVE).  THE TRANSMISSION REPAIR SHOP ACTED VERY SURPRISED THAT OUR TRANSMISSION LASTED 135K MILES! UNFORTUNATELY OUR WARRANTY COMPANY IS NOT AWARE OF THE PROBLEMS WITH THIS TRANSMISSION OR JUST DOESN'T WANT TO LOSE MONEY BECAUSE OF IT, BUT THEY ONLY PAID FOR THE INSTALLATION OF A USED TRANSMISSION WITH 80K MILES.  I USE THE ULTIMATE WARRANTY COMPANY (1-800-576-5113).   *JB    ***DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS*****770786
I CAN'T KEEP IT RUNNING IN COLD WEATHER, NO MATTER WHAT THE SPEED OF DRIVING.**** DIMS 11 IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS****769757.  *AK  *JB

NHTSA RECALL 99V213000 LIFTGATE SUPPORT BRACKET; SHE HAD THIS RECALL REPAIRED TWO YEARS AGO.  THE OWNER STATES THAT SHE HEARD SOMETHING, MOVED OUT THE WAY AND THE LIFTGATE SLAMMED SHUT ON ITS' OWN.  PLEASE DESCRIBE DETAILS.  NLM

VAN HAS PROBLEM WITH ILLUMINATION OF HEAD LIGHTS, DEALERSHIP HAS TRIED SEVERAL ATTEMPTS TO RECTIFY ILLUMINATION FAILURE.  MANUFACTURER HAS NO MORE SUGGESTIONS ON HOW TO CORRECT PROBLEM.  DEALERSHIP IS DECLINING PUTTING ON FOG LIGHTS, AND IS QUESTIONING NEXT STEP.*AK. CONSUMER'S SON ADJUSTED THE HEADLIGHTS AND CONSUMER CAN NOW SEE THE ROAD, CONSUMER ASSUMED IT WAS THE HEADLIGHTS THEMSELVES,  BUT IT SEEMS THEY WERE JUSE MISALIGNED.*JB
ENGINE SPORADICALLY DIES WHEN SLOWING DOWN FOR STOP OR TURNS.  CAN'T FIND A PATTERN - HAPPENS IN ALL SEASONS, TEMPERATURES AND ROAD CONDITIONS.*AK
CONSUMER STATES THE RIGHT FRONT WINDOW IS AT TIMES INOPERATIVE, THE DEALER REPLACED THE POWER WINDOW SWITCH AND LATER REPLACED A BAD CONNECTOR AT THE WINDOW SWITCH.   *SLC
WHILE TRYING TO OPEN HATCH GATE UP STRUT THAT HOLDS HATCH GATE SHEARED OFF  FRAME, AND GATE CAME DOWN ON CONSUMER, CAUSING SOME MINOR DAMAGES ON SHOULDER, ARM AND BACK.*AK  *YH

RECALL 00-V-305; STEERING WHEEL ARMATURE STAMPING CRACKED AND SEPARATED FROM CENTER HUB ATTACHMENT. ALSO, WHEEL NUTS ON BOTH FRONT SIDES ARE SNAPPED. THIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN RECALL DUE TO VIN.  *AK   *YD
FUEL INJECTOR IS LEAKING GAS ONTO  EXHAUST MANIFOLD.*AK
ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS LATCH ON THE REAR DOOR HATCH FAILED.   *TT

CONSUMER HAD TO STOP THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY TO AVOID AN ACCIDENT.  CONSUMERS WIFE WHO WAS SEATED IN THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT FELT A VERY LARGE JOLT TO THE VEHICLE.  THINKING THEY HAD BEEN HIT FROM BEHIND, THE WIFE TURNS TO CHECK ON THEIR 2 YEAR OLD SON WHO WAS SEATED IN BACK OF THE PASSENGER SEAT.  THE SAFETY BELT BELONGING TO THE VEHICLE HAD COME UNBUCKLED AND THE SON HAD BEEN THROWN INTO THE BACK OF THE SEAT HEAD FIRST.  SOMEONE FROM THE CARSEAT SAFETY COALITION CAME TO CONSUMERS HOME TO INSPECT THE SEATS. THEY WERE INSTALLED CORRECTLY.  CRYSLER CLAIMS IT IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A SFETY BELT TO BECOME UNBUCKLED BY ITSELF.  *JG

THE VEHICLE STALLED.THE DEALER SERVICED THE THROTTLE BODY, REPLACED THE CHECK VALVE, SERVICED THE TRANSMISSION, REPLACED THE OXYGEN SENSOR, REPLACED THE IDLE SPEED MOTOR, BUT THE PROBLEM CONTINUED.   *SLC THE POWER WINDOW SWITCH WAS REPLACED.  PH  *JB   *CB

SLIDING DOOR, HAD COLLAPSED  WITHOUT A PRIOR WARNING.  HAD TAKEN VEHICLE TO A BODY SHOP FOR REPAIRS, AND THEY COULD NOT DETERMINE WHAT HAD BEEN THE CAUSE OF SLIDING DOOR FALLING OUT.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK
REAR DOOR IS FALLING APART FROM THE TOP HINGE WHERE IT COULD SEPARATE LIKE IT HAD HAPPEN BEFORE.  DEALER HAD BEEN CONTACTED.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK
TRANSMISSION SHIFTING PROBLEM.   COULD NOT BE FIXED, AND HAD TO BE REPLACED.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK

INSURED WAS IN TURNING LANE TO MAKE A LEFT TURN AND TURNED IN FRONT OF AN ONCOMING VAN.  AIR BAG DID NOT DEPLOY.  SHOP STATES THAT SPECIFIC CRUNCH/CRIMPING IN AREA, SENSOR SHOULD HAVE GONE OFF, THERE WERE TWO INJURIES IN ACCIDENT, CLAIM 59-V722-082.  *JG

INSURED WAS IN TURNING LANE TO MAKE A LEFT TURN AND TURNED IN FRONT OF AN ONCOMING VAN.  AIR BAG DID NOT DEPLOY.  SHOP STATES THAT SPECIFIC CRUNCH/CRIMPING IN AREA, SENSOR SHOULD HAVE GONE OFF, THERE WERE TWO INJURIES IN ACCIDENT, CLAIM 59-V722-082.  *JG
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOV EVEHICLE. *AK

REAR WIPERS STOPPED WORKING.  THERE WAS A RECALL FOR WIPERS, TOOK TO DEALER, THEY CORRECTED THE PROBLEM. A YEAR LATER, WINDSHIELD WIPERS STOPPED WORKING AGAIN.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

A YOUNG CHILD GOT IN VEHICLE, PUT KEY IN IGNITION, AND WAS ABLE TO SHIFT FROM PARK TO NEUTRAL WITHOUT APPLYING BRAKES. VEHICLE ROLLED BACKWARDM, AND HIT ANOTHER VEHICLE. DAMAGE TO THAT VEHICLE WAS $2000.00. *AK   *JB

I HAVE HAD CONSISTANT PROBLEMS WITH THE 94 CARAVAN.  AS SOON AS I GET ONE PROBLEM FIXED, ANOTHER ONE POPS UP.  I HAVE BEEN INFORMED BY THE TRANSMISSION SHOP THAT THERE IS A HIGH FAILURE RATE FOR DODGE CARAVAN TRANSMISSIONS.  THIS HAS ME HIGHLY CONCERNED AS I DO NOT WANT TO HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT ANOTHER TRANSMISSION FAILURE.  THIS IS THE 2ND TIME I AM HAVING THE A/C SYSTEM FIXED.  AS FOR THE DOOR LATCH FOR THE SLIDING DOOR NOT WORKING CORRECTLY, THERE IS NOTHING I OR MY HUSBAND AM AWARE OF THAT WOULD CAUSE IT TO WORK AND THEN NOT TO WORK ON AND OFF.   THIS IS OF GREAT CONCERN SINCE THIS IS THE FAMILY CAR AND I HAVE NO IDEA OF WHEN THE LATCH MAY FAIL.  SO FAR THIS HAS NOT HAPPENED WITH MY CHILDREN IN CAR, JUST MYSELF .  EGR VALVE WAS AFFECTING ENGINE PERFORMANCE AND MILAGE.

TRANSMISSION FAILS TO DOWNSHIFT WHEN STOPPING CAUSING HANDLING PROBLEMS AND COMPONENT FAILURE. THIS IS THE 2ND TIME FOR THIS TYPE OF FAILURE WHICH COMES WITH NO WARNING. THE 1ST TIME WAS DEC. 1997 WITH ONLY 35000 MILES ON THE VEHICLE.*AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK
THE VEHICLE STALLS SUDDENLY WHILE DRIVING, THE DEALER COULD NOT DETERMINE THE CAUSE. *YH
THE VEHICLE STALLS SUDDENLY WHILE DRIVING, THE DEALER COULD NOT DETERMINE THE CAUSE. *YH

FIRST FAILURE HAPPENED ON  HIGHWAY.  DANGEROUS GETTING OFF.  SECOND FAILURE OCCURRED ON A WINDING HILL GOING UP.  CARS CAME UP FROM BEHIND AND ALMOST COLLIDED WITH REAR OF CAR.  CHRYSLER SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED TO GET AWAY WITH SUCH TRANSMISSION PROBLEMS HAS IT HAS HAD ON THESE MINIVANS.*AK

VEHICLE WAS PARKED IN  DRIVEWAY, CONSUMER WAS AWAKENED AT 3AM TO  VEHICLE BEING ON FIRE.  ENTIRE FRONT END WAS ON FIRE.  CONSUMER NOTED VEHICLE WAS A TOTAL LOSS.  DEALER STATED THEY KNEW ANY WHY IT WOULD CATCH ON FIRE.  *AK

AFTER HAVING REPAIR WORK PERFORMED FOR RECALL 99V113000 REAR WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR HAS FAILED 14 MONTHS AFTER  REPAIR WORK WAS PERFORMED.  CONSUMER COMPLAINED  THAT AIR BAG WAS NOT ON A SEPARATE ELECTRICAL FUSE, WHICH CAUSED FUSE FOR  AIR BAG TO SHORT WHEN  WIPER MOTOR FAILED.  *AK  *SLC

WHILE TRAVELING AT APPROXIMATELY 55 MPH VEHICLE SUDDENLY LOST POWER. IT FELT LIKE  IT  WAS STUCK IN PARK.   DEALERSHIP STATED THAT TRANSMISSION,  HAD BEEN REPLACED BY THIS DEALERSHIP A YEAR EARLIER AT 120,000 MILES,  HAD TO BE REPLACED AGAIN.   PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION/ATTACHMENTS.*AK

EVERY CARAVAN OWNER I TALK TO TELLS ME ABOUT THEIR TRANSMISSION FAILING. WHY HASN'T NHTSA INVESTIGATED THIS HUGE PROBLEM? MY TRANSMISSION FAILED WHILE TRAVELING 70 MPH ON THE FREEWAY. THE SHOP TOLD ME THE NUMBER ONE COMPLAINT HAS BEEN THE TRANSMISSION ON THESE VANS.  *AK

I REALLY FEEL DODGE/CHRYSLER HAS A PROBELM WITH THEIR AUTOMATIC TRANMISSIONS IN THEIR MINI-VANS, EVERYONE I KNOW HAS HAD TROUBLE AND HAD TO REPLACE THEM.  MY TURN CAME LAST WEEK, REPRTEDLY THE NEW TRANSMISSION THAT WAS INSTALLED IS RE-DESIGNED AND HAS A LONGER WARRANTY.  THERE IS SOMETHING WRONG HERE AND IT NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED.*AK

ENGINE CUTS OUT PERIODICALLY, CONSUMER WAS ADVISED BY MECHANIC TRANSMISSION NEEDED TO BE REPLACED, VEHICLE ONLY HAS 12,000 ON AN ALREADY PREVIOUSLY REBUILT TRANSMISSION AND WAS ADVISED, THAT TRANSMISSION WOULD OUT LAST THE VEHICLE.  *JB
VEHICLE WOULD PERIODICALLY VIBRATE AT CERTAIN SPEEDS 35-80 MPH WAS ADV BY MECHANIC COULD FIND NOTHING WRONG, EXCEPT FOR THE FRONT STRUTS AND WHEEL ALIGNMENT AND THAT WOULD SOLVE PROBLEM.       *JB

THE TIRE DID NOT "FAIL" BECAUSE I NOTICED THE SEPARATION OF THE TREAD BEFORE IT HAD A CHANCE TO COME OFF COMPLETELY.  THIS TIRE HAS APPROXIMATELY 30,000 MILES ON IT.  I WOULD LIKE TO BE COMPENSATED FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF ALL 4 OF MY FR680 TIRES BECAUSE I AM NO LONGER CONFIDENT THAT MY FAMILY IS SAFE.*AK (DOT NUMBER: W2M0F6L  TIRESIZE: P205/70R15)

SLIDING DOOR WOULD INTERMITTENTLY FLY OPEN WHEN MAKING A TURN OR COMING TO A STOP. MANUFACTURER NOTIFIED AND INFORMED OF NO RECALL AND  VEHICLE OUT OF ITS WARRANTY.  *AK  DOOR FLEW OPEN ON ONE OCCASION DURING AN ACCIDENT WHEN IMPACT WAS TO THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE, THE DOOR POPPED OPEN.   *SLC
VEHICLE STALLS AT ANY SPEED INTERMITTENTLY. *AK  THE VEHICLE STALLING WAS ACCOMPANIED BY LOSS OF CONTROL.  POWER STEERING AND POWER BRAKES FAILED AND THE DEALER IS UNABLE TO DIAGNOSE OR REPAIR.  *YH
ENGINE   CONSUMES A LOT OF OIL.   DEALER HAS INSPECTED VEHICLE SEVERAL TIMES AND COULD NOT CORRECT PROBLEM.*AK    THE VEHICLE HAS TRANSMISSION PROBLEM AND THE RPM MALFUNCTIONS.  *YH

AUTOMOBILE LOCK HAS A ROCKER SWITCH, AND  DOOR SWITCH DOES NOT WORK FROM  INSIDE. IN ORDER GET  AUTOMOBILE UNLOCKED FROM  INSIDE  CONSUMER MUST CUT  VEHICLE OFF, AND HAND  KEY OUT OF  WINDOW FOR SOMEONE TO UNLOCK IT.  *AK
DUE TO BAD REAR DEFROSTER REAR WINDOW ON TAILGATE EXPLODED WITH A LOUD BANG AND GLAS FLEW EVERY WHERE EVEN UP FRONT BY THE DRIVER(ME) I HAD KIDS IN THE CAR WAS A LUCKY THING THAT NO ONE WAS HURT. *AK
SERPENTINE BELT AND TENSIONER WAS PREVIOUSLY REPLACE ON 05/27/1999 (MILEAGE:63959) BY DEALER AT A COST OF $163. THE TENSIONER HAD BROKEN AND THE VEHCLE HAD TO BE TOWED.

DEFECTIVE FUEL RAIL LEAKED, CAUSING A FUEL LEAKAGE WHICH MAY RESULT IN   A FIRE.  DEALER REPLACED  FUEL RAIL UNDER WARRANTY.  CURRENTLY,THERE IS ANOTHER FUEL LEAK DUE TO  FUEL RAIL, AND POSSIBLY "O" RINGS. WILL BE TAKING TO DEALER.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

WHILE DRIVING TRANSMISSION WILL LOSE POWER AND  GEARS. THIS  MORE LIKELY  WILL HAPPEN  DURING  COLD WEATHER.  WHEN VEHICLE WARMS UP IT WILL WORK BETTER.  BUT SOMETIMES NOT EVEN  REVERSE GEAR WILL WORK.  *AK
TRANSMISSION PREMATURELY FAILED DUE TO A DESIGN FLAW. PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.    *AK

VEHICLE EXPERIENCING A FUEL RAIL FAILURE, CAUSING FUEL LEAKAGES UPON ENGINE. VEHICLE TAKEN TO INDEPENDENT REPAIR SHOP FOR REPAIRS. MANUFACTURER NOTIFIED, AND INFORMED CONSUMER THAT VEHICLE WAS NOT COVERED UNDER  RECALL DUE TO VIN.  *AK FUEL RAIL WAS REPAIRED AND RESEALED ALL INJECTORS. *JB

CONSUMER TOOK VEHICLE TO GUNN DODGE IN SAN ANTONIO TEXAS 210-599-5800 FOR RECALL 99V216000 REPAIRS.  CONSUMER NOTICED FUEL WAS LEAKING AFTER TWO OF RECALLS WERE DONE.  VEHICLE WAS TAKEN BACK TO DEALER, WHERE A TECHNICIAN SAID THAT IT HAD HAPPENED BEFORE, AND TANK HAD TO BE REPLACED.  *AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK
HAD CLASSIC SYMPTOMS FOR OVER A YEAR: STUCK 2ND GEAR, ACCELERATION SHUDDER, DELAYED ENGAGEMENT, FINALLY FAILED COMPLETELY WITH NO REVERSE GEAR.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING ON SNOW COVERED OR SLUSHY ROADS, THE ANTILOCK BRAKES CAUSED THE VEHICLE TO SKID WHEN BRAKING, THIS HAS ALMOST RESULTED IN A COUPLE DIFFERENT ACCIDENTS.   *SLC
THE REAR HINGE WHICH SUPPORTS THE SLIDING PASSENGER SIDE DOOR FAILED AND CAME OUT OF IT'S TRACK, CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO KEEP THE SIDE DOOR CLOSED.  NLM
WHILE DRIVING ON SNOW COVERED OR SLUSHY ROADS, THE ANTILOCK BRAKES CAUSED THE VEHICLE TO SKID WHEN BRAKING, THIS HAS ALMOST RESULTED IN A COUPLE DIFFERENT ACCIDENTS.   *SLC
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK
I WILL BE CONTACTING CHRYSLER.  REFER TO 97V201000 CAMPAIGN REPORT FROM NHTSA.  *AK

WHILE ATTEMPING TO STOP, THE BRAKE PEDAL GOES TO THE FLOOR WITHOUT WARNING. GRINDING NOISES IN THE BRAKES AND UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE IMPACT. REPORT PROBLEM TO DEALERSHIP AT LEAST 4 TIMES AND THEY ALWAYS SAY "NO PROBLEMS FOUND".*AK
FRONT SUSPENSION SPRINGS ARE VERY WEAK.  SUSPENSIONS WOULD BOTTOM OUT LIKE METAL TO METAL WHEN GOING OVER BUMPS OR CRACKS.  SHOCKS WERE REPLACED DUE TO THE PROBLEM WITH SUSPENSION SPRINGS.  *AK

I READ AN ARTICLE REGARDING SCHOOL BUSES HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THEIR BRAKES, THE SAME IS HAPPENING WITH MY 94 DODGE CARAVAN LE 3.3 WHEN THE VEHICLE IS MOVING SLOWLY USUALLY LESS THAN 20MPH AND I GO TO BRAKE , THEY TEMPORARILY LOSE THEIR BRAKING ABILITY FOR A FEW SECONDS AS IF THE ABS KICKS IN FOR A FEW SECONDS ON ITS OWN.

I READ AN ARTICLE REGARDING SCHOOL BUSES HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THEIR BRAKES, THE SAME IS HAPPENING WITH MY 94 DODGE CARAVAN LE 3.3 WHEN THE VEHICLE IS MOVING SLOWLY USUALLY LESS THAN 20MPH AND I GO TO BRAKE , THEY TEMPORARILY LOSE THEIR BRAKING ABILITY FOR A FEW SECONDS AS IF THE ABS KICKS IN FOR A FEW SECONDS ON ITS OWN.
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK
PAINT IS PEELING OFF THE TOP OF THE VAN, AS WELL AS THE HOOD AND THE TAILGATE. NO SAFETY DEFECT MENTIONED. *AK
DRIVER'S DOOR HAS A STRESS CRACK AT THE WELDS AND HINGES OF THE DOOR WHICH WON'T SHUT THE DOOR PROPERLY, WON'T SHUT TO THE 2ND LATCH.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK

BATTERY CABLES BEGAN TO MELT, AND THE WIRE HARNESS CAUGHT FIRE, THIS CAUSED THE VEHICLE TO RUN, NO STOP THE VEHICLE COULD NOT BE TURNED OFF.  FIRE DEPARTMENT CAME TO PUT THE FIRE OUT.  DEALER HAS NOT BEEN CONTACTED.*AK
1. AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSIONS LOCKS UP IN SECOND GEAR, RPM'S WILL DOUBLE, SPEED BECOMES LIMITED.  2. WINDOW ON REAR HATCH IS OOZING GLUE AND THE WINDOW IS BUCKELING.

THE REAR DOOR LATCH FAILS TO OPERATE CORRECTLY NOW.  DEALERSHIP SERVICE WRITER SAID IT WAS DUE TO THE REAR DOOR LATCH BEING BENT.  WE HAVE NOT DONE ANYTHING THAT WE KNOW OF THAT WOULD HAVE CAUSED THIS TO OCCUR.  SUSPECT TOO WEAK A COMPONENT BEING USED IN THE MANUFACTURE OF THE VEHICLE.  WE HAVE HAD OTHER MIN-VANS WHERE THE SIDE DOOR WAS USED MORE FREGUENTLY THAN ON OUR CURRENT VEHICLE WITHOUT ANY OF THE SAME PROBLEMS OCURRING.  STRONGLY FEEL THAT THIS IS A MANUFACTURING DEFECT AND WE SHOULD NOT HAVE TO PAY FOR ANY REPAIRS.3 4RRONE

THE SLIDING DOOR HAS BEEN AN ISSUE SINCE WE FIRST GOT OUR MINIVAN.  AT FIRST THE DEALER CLAIMED THAT THE HINGE WAS BAD - IT WAS ONLY A FEW MONTHS OLD.  THE NEXT TIME THAT I TOOK IT IN FOR THIS THEY SAID THAT WE WERE EXPERIENCING NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR.  I REFUSED TO PAY STATING THAT A NEW VEHICLE WITH LESS THAN 20,000 MILES DOORS HINDGES AND LATCHES WEARING OUT IS NOT NORMAL.  THE NEXT TIME THE DOOR WOULD NOT CLOSE IT WAS THE LATCH, THE NEXT TIME IT WAS THE UPPER HINDGE THEN THE LOWER AND BACK AND FORTH.  FOR OVER SIX YEARS WE HAVE HAD LATCHES AND HINDGES REPLACED.  HALF THE TIME THE DOOR WONT OPEN, THE OTHER HALF IT WONT CLOSE. OH, THEN THERES THOSE TIMES THE DOOR JUST FLYS OPEN AS WE ACCELARATE OR TURN A CORNER.   THE DEALER HAS STATED THAT WE NEED TO BUY A NEW DOOR AND THEN HAVE THE FRAME REBENT.  AS I HAVE SPOKE WITH OTHER OWNERS OF THIS SAME MAKE AND MODEL MINIVAN THEY HAVE HAD THE SAME TYPE OF PROBLEMS.  OR THE DOOR HAS JUST FALLEN OFF.  IN ADDITION TO THIS ALL OF OUR PAINT IS PEELING OFF.  WE HAD INTENDED TO KEEP THIS THROUGH  TILL THE YEAR 2004. HOWEVER I AM BECOMING INCREASINGLY CONCERED SINCE OUR DAUGHTER ALMOST FELL OUT AS WE TURNED A CORNER AND THE SLIDING DOOR FLEW OPEN THEN AS SHE IS FASTENED IN LEANED AS THE DOOR SLAMMED CLOSED.  THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR CAREFULL AND FULL INVESTIGATION INTO THIS MATTER.  GIVEN THAT THIS IS ONLY SIX YEARS OLD I FEEL THAT THE MANUFATURE SHOULD NOT CLAIM THAT THIS IS NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR.
TRANSMISSION IS HESITATING & WON'T CATCH IN 2ND GEAR.  DEALER  PUT  VEHICLE ON THE DIAGNOSTIC MACHINE & FOUND FAILURE OF 2ND GEAR. WARRANTY HAD EXPIRED. *AK
ALL DOOR HINGES HAVE EITHER COME LOOSE OR HAVE RUSTED, CAUSING THE  DOORS NOT TO SHUT CORRECTLY.  MANUFACTURER WILL BE NOTIFIED ABOUT THE PROBLEM. *AK *ML

THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM IS A REAL PROBLEM. I HAVE HAD SEVEN FAILURES. ONE OF THE COMPRESSOR FAILURES RESULTED IN A THE COMPRESSOR  LOCKING UP AND MAKING THE CAR INOPERABLE IN TRAFFIC AND HEATED TO THE POINT OF BURNING INTERNAL PARTS. THIS CAR IS MADE TO CARRY CHILDREN AND HAS NO ADEQUATE VENTILATION SINCE REAR WINDOWS ONLY CRACK OPEN. WHEN AIR CONDITIONING FAILS IN THIS TYPE OF VEHICLE, IT PRESENTS A REAL PROBLEM WITH SMALL CHILDREN RIDING IN HIGH HEAT AS WE HAD TO WHEN TRAVELING IN SUMMER. THIS IS MORE THAN A DRIVER COMFORT- EXPENSIVE REPETATIVE REPAIR ISSUE. *AK
THE INTERNET IS CHOCK FULL OF CONSUMERS REPORTING PROBLEMS WITH CHRYSLER CORPORATIONS AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSIONS.  WHY IS IT TAKING YOU SO LONG TO DO SOMETHING ABOUT THIS?  *AK

I BELIEVE THAT THIS VAN WAS A "LEMON" FROM THE START.  IT WAS PURCHASED WITH 60,000 MILES ON IT LESS THAN 2 YEARS AGO.  THE DEALERSHIP, "AURORA CHRYSLER-PLYMOUTH" DID WHAT THEY CALLED A SAFETY CHECK ON IT.  SOMEHOW  THEY FAILED TO FIND THAT BOTH TIE ROD ENDS NEEDED REPLACED.   THAT WAS WITHIN 1 MONTH OF PURCHASE.  WE TOOK IT TO A MORE LOCAL DEALER FOR THE SERVICE.  THEN BEFORE WE HAD 84,000 MILES ON IT, THE TRANSMISSION HAD TO BE COMPLETELY REBUILT.  NOW THE ENGINE HAS FAILED E-CHECK WITH MAJOR PROBLEMS.  AFTER READING ALL THE CONSUMER COMPLAINTS ON FAILED TRANSMISSIONS, I AM VERY SURPRISED THAT THERE HAS NEVER BEEN A "FORCED" RECALL ON THESE.  I ALSO WONDER HOW MANY OTHER ENGINE FAILURES ARE OUT THERE, NOT BEING REPORTED.

CONSUMER HAD TO REPLACE OLD SERPENTINE BELT BECAUSE IT WAS CRACKED.  NEW ONE KEEPS SLIPPING OFF. CONSUMER REPLACED BELT PINCHNER JUST IN CASE THAT WAS THE PROBLEM.  HOWEVER,  CONSUMER ENDED UP PUTTING THE OLD CRACKED BELT BACK ON & IT STAYED ON WITHOUT ANY  PROBLEM.  *AK

SET CRUISE CONTROL ON 55MPH AND  VEHICLE ACCLERATED UPT 80 MPH.   DRIVER PRESSED THE BRAKES AND THE VEHICLE SLOWED DOWN. BUT THEN DRIVER TOOK FOOT OFF THE BRAKES  AND VEHICLE CONTINUED TO SPEED.   DRIVER HAD TO PULL OVER AND TURN OFF THE VEHICLE.  THIS OCCURRENCE HAPPENED ONCE.  CRUISE HAS WORKED OK SINCE. *AK *ML

THE SLIDING SIDE DOOR EXTERIOR SUPPORT TRACK IN THE BODY PANEL IS WORN OUT. THIS CAUSES MIS-ALIGNMENT OF DOOR LATCH AND STATIONARY LATCH PIN WHILE CLOSING THE DOOR. THE LATCH JAMS ON THE HEAD OF THE LATCH PIN. DOOR APPEARS TO BE CLOSED BUT IS NOT SECURE AND COMES OPEN WHILE DRIVING.

COMPUTER FAILED POSSIBLY DUE TO TRANSMISSION FAILING WHICH HAPPENED PRIOR. ALSO, SLIDING DOOR LATCH IS STUCK , WHICH WILL NOT ALLOW DOOR TO OPEN OR CLOSE. CAUSE IS UNKNOWN.  *AK
THERE WAS A LOUD NOISE COMING FROM THE MOTOR DUE TO THE SWAY BAR BREAKING IN HALF. DEALER HAS NOT SEEN VEHICLE.  *AK
DRIVER'S AND PASSENGER'S DOOR HINGES BROKE,  CAUSING THE DOORS TO FALL OFF WHICH MAY RESULT IN  INJURIES. *AK

DRIVER STARTED TO SMELL GAS WHILE VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION. DRIVER NOTICED ABOUT A PINT OF GAS WAS LEAKING ON TOP OF ENGINE, RESULTING IN A FIRE HAZARD. CAUSE  UNKNOWN. AFTER THE LAST TIME THE INCIDENT OCCURED, DRIVER SHUT VEHICLE OFF, AND WHEN TURNED BACK ON, EVERYTHING WAS NORMAL.  PROBLEM HAS BOT OCCURRED SINCE. *AK *ML

TRANSMISSION STARTED ACTING-UP APPROX. TEN MONTHS AGO. VEHICLE DEVELOPED A SHUDDER AROUND 40 MPH WHEN TRANSMISSION WAS SHIFTING FROM DRIVE INTO OVER-DRIVE. RECENTLY, WHEN COLD, THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT MOVE WHEN PUT INTO REVERSE. UPON CONTACTING A RECOMMENDED TRANSMISSION REPAIR SHOP, I WAS TOLD THAT THESE WERE COMMON PROBLEMS WITH CHRYSLER PRODUCED MINI VANS. THEY EXPLAINED TO ME THAT THE SHUDDER WAS MOST LIKELY CAUSED BY A BROKEN SNAP-RING THAT THE MANUFACTURER MADE TOO THIN AND THE REASON THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT MOVE WHEN PUT INTO REVERSE WAS THAT THE INTERNAL SEALS WERE FAILING BECAUSE THE MANUFACTURER MADE THEM OUT OF THE WRONG MATERIAL. I UNDERSTAND THAT CHRYSLER HAS REPAIR KITS TO TAKE CARE OF THESE DEFECTS. MY QUESTION IS: IF THIS IS SUCH A COMMON PROBLEM, WHY HASN'T THERE BEEN A RECALL? WE ARE FACING A REPAIR BILL OF WELL OVER $1000 BECAUSE OF THE AMOUNT OF LABOR INVOLVED TO CORRECT PROBLEM. IS CHRYSLER DOING ANYTHING FOR CUSTOMERS REGARDING THIS SITUATION? *AK
REPORTING A SPONTANEOUS LEAKING OF FUEL FROM PLASTIC FUEL TANKS, AND UNABLE TO RELACE/REPAIR DUE TO NATIONAL BACK ORDERS. DEALER/MANUFACTURER NOTIFIED. *AK

WIFE WAS GOING TO HER SECOND JOB ON GRANT AVE THIS MORNING AT 8:30AM,VERY SUNNY WITH SUN GLARE,BLACK ICE ON ROAD,WIFE HIT THE CAR IN FRONT OF HER,THAT HIT SOMEONE ELSE.MY WAE WEARING HER SEAT BELT AT THAT TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.SIR THE DRIVER-SIDE AIR BAG IN   STEERING WHEEL DID NOT OPEN,NOR DID THE PASSENER  - SIDE OPEN EITHER THIE THE 3RD TIME THIS AS HAPPEN. EVEN AFTER THE RECALL THE PROBLEM WAS STILL THERE AND WE DID NOT KNOW IT. WHAT IT GOING TO TAKE THE DEATH OF MY  WIFE TO GET TO THE BOTTOM OF THIS ON GOING PROBLEM WITH HER MIMI-VAN SIR. WE NEED HELP, SINCE CHRYSLER CAN FIX THIS PROBLEM. IT IS NOT FAIR TO LET THIS STONE BE OVER LOOKED.PLEASE HELP US.MY WIFE DID GET HURT IN THIS ACCIDENT TODAY THANK YOU VERY MUCH THE CASON FAMILY.  *AK
EVAPORATOR CORE AND ASSOCIATED PARTS WERE REPLACED. *AK

AN ARTICLE RELEASED BY THE ASSOCIATED PRESS ON 12/31/98 INDICATED THAT CHRYSLER WAS AWARE OF A PROBLEM WITH THE O-RINGS INSTALLED ON THE FUEL INJECTORS OF THE V-6 (3.3L) ENGINES MANUFACTURED IN 1993. THEY INDICATED THAT THERE HAVE BEEN SOME OCCURRANCES OF FIRE DUE TO FUEL LEAKS CAUSED BY THIS HARDENED O-RING. MY VEHICLE IS HAVING THIS SAME PROBLEM. FUEL IS LEAKING FROM AROUND THE BASE OF THE FUEL INJECTOR CAUSING FUEL TO POOL UP ON TOP OF THE ENGINE WHICH IS A DEFINITE FIRE HAZARD AND ALSO A HEALTH HAZARD CAUSED BY THE AMOUNT OF FUMES. I WOULD LIKE THIS RESEARCHED TO SEE IF THE RECALL SHOULD HAVE BEEN EXTENDED TO INCLUDE 1994 3.3L V-6 ENGINES AS WELL. THIS IS THE SECOND OCCURRENCE OF THIS PROBLEM IN THE LAST TWO MONTHS. IT HAS BEEN FORTUNATE THAT NO FIRE RESULTED FROM THIS FAILURE. PLEASE ADVISE ME IF THERE IS MORE INFORMATION I CAN SUPPLY IN REFERENCE TO THIS REQUEST.  *AK

ON 12/23/98 I TOOK MY VAN TO SERVICE DEPT.@ KAMAAINA MOTORS AFTER MY AIRBAG LITE STAYED ON.  ALSO MY REAR WINDSHIELD WIPER WAS NOT WORKING.ON 5 JAN. 99 THEY FIXED THE FUSE AND I WAS TOLD THE CAR  WAS FINE.ON 16 AUG. 99 I RECEIVED A RECALL FROM MANUFACTURER .THEY THEN INSTALLED A PATCH(MASTIC) MY MILEAGE AT THIS TIME WAS 64940.ON DEC.20 99 MY AIR BAG STAYED ON AGAIN  AND SHORTED MY REAR WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR. THIS IS THE 3RD TIME IAM HAVING THIS FIXED  PLEASE HELP ME BECAUSE IM WORRIED THAT IT HAPPEN AGAIN.THW2MY MIL

TRANSMISSION FAILURE IN MY MINIVAN AT 38,000 MILES.  TRANSMISSION HAS BEEN REPLACED, SINCE PROBLEM AT A COST OF $1461.50.  I FEEL THAT A MAJOR COMPONENT AS A TRANSMISSION SHOULD NOT FAIL AT 38,000 MILES.  THE TRANSMISSION FLUID WAS CHANGED ON 04/01/1999, AT 35,262 MILES.  IT WASN'T BECAUSE OF THE FLUID.
PREMATURE TRANSMISSION FAILURE SEEMS PROBLEMATIC; NEEDS NHTSA INVESTIGATION & RECALL.  HATCH LATCH FAILED AFTER RECALLED PART REPAIRED. *AK

IN JAN 1998, I NOTICED SURFACE DAMAGE THAT LOOKED LIKE SPOTS. OVER THE MONTHS AFTER REPEATED WASHES AND WAXES, THE SPOTS GREW IN SIZE. THE SPOTS STARTED ETCHING BELOW THE TOP SURFACE. A COUPLE OF MONTHS AFTERWARD I STARTED TO SEE A GRAY SURFACES APPEAR WHERE THE SPOTS WERE. DURING A SERVICE VISIT IN MID 1998 TO MY LOCAL CHRYSLER/DODGE DEALER IN FORT COLLINS, CO., I THEN ASKED THEM WHAT CAUSES THIS AND WHETHER TOUCHUP PAINT WOULD WORK TO FIX THE SURFACE. THEY SAID THE CAUSE WAS ENIVORMENTAL EFFECTS ON PAINT. I TOOK THEIR WORD ON IT AND PURCHASED THE TOUCHUP PAINT. SINCE THAT TIME, THE PAINT ON THE TOP ROOF IS COMING OFF IN LARGE FLAKES. A GRAY SURFACE NOW COMPRISES ABOUT 15% OF THE TOTAL AREA. AT THE PRESENT RATE OF FLAKING, THE ENTIRE TOP WILL BE BARE WITHIN TWO MONTHS. ESTIMATES FOR SANDING AND REPAINTING THE TOP WITH BE $1500.00 AND CHRYSLER WILL PARTICIPATE $220.91 TOWARDS REPAINTING THE ROOF AS A GOODWILL GESTURE. THIS IS NOT ENOUGH COMPENSATION. I FEAR THAT OTHER AREAS ON MY VEHICLE WILL SOON START TO SHOW THE SAME PROBLEM. MANY OTHER FAMILY, FRIENDS AND OWNERS NATIONWIDE ARE REPORTING SIMILIAR PROBLEMS. INFORMATION THAT I OBTAINED THROUGH SOURCES INDICATES THAT CHRYSLER IS AWARE OF THE INCOMPATABILITY OF THE WATER BASED CLEAR COAT AND THE DRY BASED PRIMER AND HOW THE SUN CAUSED THE PRIMER TO OXIDIZE AND CAUSED THE PAINT NOT TO ADHERE. INFORMATION HAS BEEN PROVIDED BY A CHRYSLER EMPLOYEE ON THE INTERNET ON PAINTS USED BY CHRYSLER AND SOME OF THE RELATED PROBLEMS. THE PROBLEM SEEMS TO STEM FROM CHRYSLER NOT ACKNOWLEDGING A PEELING PROBLEM RELATED TO THE ELIMINATION OF SPRAY PRIMER ON THEIR ASSEMBLY LINES. THEY ARE PRESENTLY BEING SUED IN SEVERAL STATES OVER THIS PROBLEM, BUT THE LAWSUITS ARE NOT SPECIFIC ABOUT THE AFFECTED MODELS OR YEARS. THERE HAVE ALSO BEEN NUMEROUS COMPLAINTS ABOUT CARS AND TRUCKS MANUFACTURED WITH SPRAY PRIMER, AS WELL AS VEHICLES NEWER THAN MODEL YEAR 1993. I WOULD BE WILLING TO SEND PHOTO'S TO BACKUP MY COMPLAINT.  *AK

WHILE BRAKING, THE INSTANT THE BRAKE PEDAL IS DEPRESSED THE ANTILOCK BRAKE LIGHT COMES ON- AT THE SAME TIME IT FEELS LIKE THE FRONT BRAKES RELEASE, THE PEDAL FEELS HARD, AMOUNT OF BRAKING FORCE IS GREATLY REDUCED RESULTING IN NEAR ACCIDENT DUE TO INCREASE IN STOPPING DISTANCE.  ESTIMATED OCCURRENCE IS FOUR TIMES OVER A FEW WEEKS.  OCCURS WITHOUT WARNING.  OTHERWISE BRAKING IS NORMAL. WHILE DRIVING WE EXPERENCED A LOUD EXPLOSIVE SOUND WHICH WAS THE FAILURE OF THE BOLT HOLDING THE RIGHT GATE LIFT STRUT ON THE GATE AND BLOWING THE STRUT OFF. THE GATE WAS CLOSED BUT HAD IT BEEN OPEN IT WOULD HAVE CAUSED INJURY TO THE PERSON UNDER IT.
BELT TENSIONER: PULLEY SHEARED OFF WHILE PARKING, CAUSING ENGINE FAILURE AND LOSS OF POWER STEERING, ETC.  VEHICLE TOWED TO DEALER FOR REPAIR.  *AK
CONSUMER'S SEATBELT BROKE. SHE NOTIFIED THE DEALER. *AK

TRANSMISSION FAILED IN MAY 1998.  TRANSMISSION WAS REPAIRED ONCE AND THEN RETURNED 2 WEEKS LATER FOR FURTHER REPAIRS FOR SAME PROBLEM.  TRANSMISSION OPERATED WELL UNTIL JULY 1999 WHEN IT FAILED WHILE DRIVING WHICH RESULTED IN TOWING OF VEHICLE.  WE RETURNED THE VEHICLE TO THE SAME TRANSMISSION REPAIR SERVICE.  HE DIDN'T UNDERSTAND WHAT WENT WRONG WITH THE TRANSMISSION.  HE AGREED TO REPAIR THE TRANSMISSION ONCE AGAIN, CHARGING US OVER $800 (BUT NO LABOR CHARGE).  HE FURTHER STATED THAT THERE WOULD BE NO WARRANTY ON THIS WORK.  WHAT IS WRONG WITH THE TRANSMISSIONS IN THESE VEHICLES????  WE PREVIOUSLY OWNED A 1988 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN WHICH ALSO HAD TRANSMISSION PROBLEMS.... CAUSING US TO REPLACE IT.  SO MANY PEOPLE ARE HAVING TRANSMISSION PROBLEMS.... BUT THE DODGE DEALER KEEPS TELLING US THERE IS NO RECALL... ONLY LOTS OF COMPLAINTS.
WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES PEDAL BECAME STIFF AND VEHICLE DID NOT STOP. ALSO, THE ABS WARNING LIGHT CAME ON. DEALER HAD TO CLEAR ALL THE CODES OUT OF THE ABS SYSTEM. PROBLEM OCCURRED AGAIN.  *AK
TRANSMISSION WILL NOT SHIFT INTO DRIVE, IT SITS STILL FOR A COUPLE OF MINUTES BEFORE TAKING OFF. IT'S ALSO HARD TO SHIFT GEARS. DEALER HAS NOT SEEN VEHICLE.  *AK
THE LIFTGATE BOLT BROKE IN HALF WHICH COULD HAVE CAUSED INJURIES.  *AK
FRONTAL SEATBELT WILL NOT RETRACT BACK INTO POSITION ,CAUSING A LOSS OF PROTECTION.  *AK

PROBLEM WITH CAR SHAKING (SWAYING, WOBBLE) LEFT AND RIGHT AT 40 MPH.  HAVE CHANGED FRONT STRUTS, REAR SHOCKS, RACK AND PINION, LUG NUTS, AND HAD TWO MECHANICS TRY TO FIND PROBLEM TO NO AVAIL.  IF THERE IS ANY INFORMATION AS TO A PROBLEM WITH THESE VEHICLES I WOULD APRRECIATE KNOWING ABOUT IT AND WHAT THE CURE IS.  THANK YOU  JA CULLEN

FAILURE OF BOLT ATTACHING THE RIGHT LIFTGATE STRUT ROD TO VEHICLE.  THE BOLT BROKE OFF WHEN LIFTING THE LIFTGATE.  THIS CAUSED THE LIFT ROD (HYDRAULICALLY PRESSURIZED) TO EXTEND, PUNCHING A HOLE IN THE HEADLINER OF THE MINIVAN.  THERE IS NO SECONDARY 'CATCHER' MECHANISM TO RESTRAIN THE STRUT ROD IF THIS BOLT BREAKS.  ALSO, THE LIFTGATE IS TOO HEAVY FOR THE OTHER LIFTGATE TO SUPPORT IT ALONE, OR TO SLOWLY LET THE LIFTGATE DOWN.  THEREFORE, IF THE BOLT FAILURE HAD OCCURED WHEN THE LIFTGATE WAS RAISED UP, THE LIFTGATE WOULD HAVE SLAMMED DOWN UNCONTROLLABLY.  HAD I BEEN UNDER THE LIFTGATE, I COULD HAVE BEEN SERIOUSLY INJURED.  HAD MY TODDLER BEEN THERE, HE COULD HAVE BEEN FATALLY INJURED.  IT IS AMAZING TO ME THAT THIS DESIGN IS ALLOWED SINCE ONE FAILURE OF ONE BOLT COULD CAUSE SERIOUS OR FATAL INJURIES.

THE VAN, WITHOUT WARNING, LOST POWER AND EVENTUALLY STOPPED ON THE INTERSTATE 75.  AFTER LETTING THE VAN SIT FOR 15-20 MINUTES WE WERE ABLE TO START THE VAN AGAIN AND HAVE DRIVEN IT SINCE THAT TIME WITHOUT A REOCCURENCE OF THAT PROBLEM.  WE HAVE  EXPLAINED THE INCIDENT TO OUR LOCAL DODGE DEALER AND HAVE HAD THE VAN CHECKED OUT. THEY DIDN'T FIND ANY PROBLEM.  THIS IS THE THIRD TIME THAT THIS HAS HAPPENED.  THE INCIDENTS HAVE BEEN A COUPLE OF YEARS APART BUT TWO OF THEM HAVE OCCURRED WHILE DRIVING AT HIGH SPEEDS ON THE INTERSTATE AND WE HAVE HAD BEARLY ENOUGH POWER TO MAKE IT TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  OTHER THAN THESE THREE INCIDENTS THE VAN HAS PERFORMED WELL. I HAD NOT FILED A REPORT BEFORE NOW BECAUSE I DIDN'T KNOW ABOUT THIS WEB SITE AND ONLY FOUND IT THROUGH CONSUMER REPORTS WEB SITE WHILE LOOKING FOR A NEW VAN.  *AK
MY WIFE WAS CLOSING THE REAR DOOR WHEN THE ANCHOR BOLT HOLDING THE LIFT CYLINDER BROKE OFF, CAUSING THE DOOR TO FALL.  *AK

WHILE PASSING ANOTHER VEHICLE THE TRANSMISSION SLIPPED OUT OF GEAR THEN IMMEDIATELY SHIFTED INTO 2ND GEAR CAUSING RAPID DECELERATION, ALMOST THROWING VEHICLE OUT OF CONTROL.  AFTER SHUTTING THE ENGINE OFF THE TRANSMISSION RESET ITSELF, BUT CONTINUED GOING INTO 2ND GEAR SEVERAL TIMES UNTIL WE COULD GET TO A DEALER.  REPAIR ORDER STATES TRANSMISSION OVERHAUL, REPLACE FRONT PUMP AND TORQUE CONVERTER.  AFTER DOING RESEARCH ON THE INTERNET, THE TRANSMISSION APPEARS TO BE A MAJOR PROBLEM FOR DODGE MINIVANS.  IF THE ROAD WOULD HAVE BEEN WET OR SNOW COVERED, THIS PROBLEM COULD HAVE CAUSED A MAJOR ACCIDENT.

WHILE DRIVING AT 20 MPH HEARD EXPLOSION. LOOKED IN REARVIEW MIRROW AND REAR WINDOW HAD BLOWN OUT INTO LITTLE PIECES. DEALER NOT AWARE OF THE PROBLEM. IMPACT WAS FROM INSIDE TO OUTSIDE. GLASS CORP. STATES  CAUSE MAY HAVE BEEN DEFROSTER.   *AK
BOLT BROKEN ON ONE OF THE GAS FILLED PISTONS THAT HOLD THE REAR LIFTGATE OPEN CAUSING THE LIFTGATE SUPPORT TO FALL DOWN BETWEEN THE LIFTGATE AND THE BUMPER AND THE GLASS TO SHATTER.

THE PROBLEM WITH THE TRANSMISSION WAS IN THE "SNAP RINGS". OUR MECHANIC SAID HE SEES THIS QUITE FREQUENTLY.  IN LOOKING AT ALL THE COMPLAINTS ON THE INTERNET, I'D SAY THIS IS AN UNDERSTATEMENT.  PEOPLE WHO HAVE HAD PROBLEMS WITH TRANSMISSIONS GOING OUT SHOULD BE COMPENSATED FOR THEIR REPAIRS. THIS DOES NOT ONLY SEEM TO BE A PROBLEM WITH THE ORIGINIAL TRANSMISSIONS,BUT ALSO WITH THE ONES THAT ARE BEING SOLD AS REPLACEMENTS. IT IS REALLY AMAZING THAT WITH ALL THE COMPLAINTS THAT HAVE BEEN POSTED ON THE INTERNET THAT THERE HASN'T BEEN ANY INFORMATION IN THE NEWS ABOUT THIS. I INTEND TO GET EVERY PENNY BACK FROM CHRYSLER,AND WOULD GREATLY APPRECIATE IT IF YOU COULD GIVE ME SOME ADVICE AS TO HOW I CAN.  I ALSO BELIEVE YOU SHOULD ISSUE SOME STATEMENT ABOUT THIS TO THE NEWS. PEOPLE DESERVE TO KNOW ABOUT THIS.  *AK
AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION MALFUNCTIONS. THERE IS NO REVERSE AND TRANSMISSION SLIPPING INTO GEAR.  DEALER NEEDS TO HAVE A REBUILT TRANSMISSION INSTALLED.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK
AFTER TURNING THE DEFROSTER ON THE REAR WINDOW SHATTERED AND BLEW OUT. DEALER CAN'T FIND THE REASON.  *AK
